required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Identification of Underlying Conditions in Men Prescribed a PDE5 Inhibitor
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence and Incidence of Underlying Disease Diagnosed in Men With Erectile Dysfunction When Prescribed a PDE5i for the First Time

brief_summary.textblock: Erectile dysfunction (ED) has been identified as an independent risk factor for existing cardiovascular disease, preceding a major cardiovascular event by an average of about 5 years. Are men prescribed a PDE5 inhibitor for ED more likely to have a new diagnosis of underlying medical conditions compared to men of a similar age not receiving PDE5 inhibitor treatment?

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Underlying Condition Until Day -1 of the Index PDE5i Prescription
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day -92 up to Day -1 of index prescription
primary_outcome.description: Underlying conditions were defined as any diagnosis of interest recorded in the relevant time period. Diagnoses of interest were coded and categorized in to vasculogenic, urologic, neurogenic, hormonal, drug induced and psychogenic disorders.

primary_outcome.measure: Cumulative Percentage of Participants With New Diagnosis of Underlying Condition Between Index PDE5i Prescription (Day 0) and Day 91
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 to Day 91 post index prescription
primary_outcome.description: New diagnosis of underlying condition at prescription was defined as any new diagnosis of interest recorded in the relevant time period. Diagnoses of interest were coded and categorized in to vasculogenic, urologic, neurogenic, hormonal, drug induced and psychogenic disorders.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With New Diagnosis of Underlying Condition Between Day -92 and Day -1 Prior to the Index PDE5i Prescription
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day -92 up to Day -1 of index prescription
primary_outcome.description: New diagnosis of underlying condition was defined as any new diagnosis of interest recorded in the relevant time period. Diagnoses of interest were coded and categorized in to vasculogenic, urologic, neurogenic, hormonal, drug induced and psychogenic disorders.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With New Diagnosis of Underlying Condition Between Day 366 and Day 457 Post the Index PDE5i Prescription
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 366 up to Day 457 post index prescription
primary_outcome.description: New diagnosis of underlying condition was defined as any new diagnosis of interest recorded in the relevant time period. Diagnoses of interest were coded and categorized in to vasculogenic, urologic, neurogenic, hormonal, drug induced and psychogenic disorders.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Underlying Condition at PDE5i Market Introduction During the Early Study Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years (Early study period - January 1999 to December 2001)
primary_outcome.description: Underlying condition at PDE5i market introduction was defined as any diagnosis of interest until day -1 in participants who received the index prescription between January 1, 1999 and December 31, 2001 for the three years period combined. Diagnoses of interest were coded and categorized in to vasculogenic, urologic, neurogenic, hormonal, drug induced and psychogenic disorders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With New Diagnosis of Underlying Condition at PDE5i Market Introduction During the Early Study Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years (Early study period - January 1999 to December 2001)
secondary_outcome.description: New diagnosis of underlying condition at PDE5i market introduction was defined as any new diagnosis of interest until day -1 in participants who received the index prescription between January 1, 1999 and December 31, 2001 for the three years period combined. Diagnoses of interest were coded and categorized in to vasculogenic, urologic, neurogenic, hormonal, drug induced and psychogenic disorders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Underlying Condition at PDE5i Establishment During the End of Study Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years (End of study period - July 2006 to June 2008)
secondary_outcome.description: Underlying condition at PDE5i market introduction was defined as any diagnosis of interest until day -1 in participants who received the index prescription between July 1, 2006 and June 30, 2008 for the two years period combined. Diagnoses of interest were coded and categorized in to vasculogenic, urologic, neurogenic, hormonal, drug induced and psychogenic disorders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With New Diagnosis of Underlying Condition at PDE5i Establishment During the End of Study Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years (End of study period - July 2006 to June 2008)
secondary_outcome.description: New diagnosis of underlying condition at PDE5i establishment was defined as any new diagnosis of interest between day 0 (index prescription) and day 91 in participants who received the index prescription between July 1, 2006 and June 30, 2008 for the two-years period combined. Diagnoses of interest were coded and categorized in to vasculogenic, urologic, neurogenic, hormonal, drug induced and psychogenic disorders.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with a PDE5 inhibitor prescription and within the age-match control.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Records of men aged >18 years with an index PDE5 inhibitor (sildenafil, tadalafil or vardenafil) prescription between January 1st, 1999, and June 30th, 2008
- no prior PDE5 inhibitor prescription before the index prescription
- continuous enrolment with medical history for â‰¥60 months prior to the index prescription date
Exclusion Criteria:
- Records of female subjects and any male subjects not meeting the inclusion criteria will be excluded
- A subject can only be selected once independent of the assignment to the target or the control populations.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Index PDE5i Prescription
group.description: Participants who received index phosphodiesterase type 5 inhibitor (PDE5i) (sildenafil, tadalafil or vardenafil) prescription between January 1, 1999 and June 30, 2008, as identified from the United Kingdom - The Health Improvement Network (UK-THIN) database (target population).

group.title: Control (Without PDE5i Prescription)
group.description: Age-matched participants without any PDE5i (sildenafil, tadalafil or vardenafil) prescription between January 1, 1999 and June 30, 2008, as identified from the UK-THIN database (control population).

group.title: Index PDE5i Prescription
group.description: Participants who received index phosphodiesterase type 5 inhibitor (PDE5i) (sildenafil, tadalafil or vardenafil) prescription between January 1, 1999 and June 30, 2008, as identified from the United Kingdom - The Health Improvement Network (UK-THIN) database (target population).

group.title: Control (Without PDE5i Prescription)
group.description: Age-matched participants without any PDE5i (sildenafil, tadalafil or vardenafil) prescription between January 1, 1999 and June 30, 2008, as identified from the UK-THIN database (control population).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Underlying Condition Until Day -1 of the Index PDE5i Prescription
outcome.description: Underlying conditions were defined as any diagnosis of interest recorded in the relevant time period. Diagnoses of interest were coded and categorized in to vasculogenic, urologic, neurogenic, hormonal, drug induced and psychogenic disorders.
outcome.time_frame: Day -92 up to Day -1 of index prescription
outcome.population: Evaluable analysis population included all participants who received an index PDE5i prescription (sildenafil, tadalafil or vardenafil) during the study period (target population) and age-matched participants without any PDE5i prescription during the study period (control population). Last observation carried forward method was used.

group.title: Index PDE5i Prescription
group.description: Participants who received index phosphodiesterase type 5 inhibitor (PDE5i) (sildenafil, tadalafil or vardenafil) prescription between January 1, 1999 and June 30, 2008, as identified from the United Kingdom - The Health Improvement Network (UK-THIN) database (target population).

group.title: Control (Without PDE5i Prescription)
group.description: Age-matched participants without any PDE5i (sildenafil, tadalafil or vardenafil) prescription between January 1, 1999 and June 30, 2008, as identified from the UK-THIN database (control population).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Underlying Condition Until Day -1 of the Index PDE5i Prescription
measure.description: Underlying conditions were defined as any diagnosis of interest recorded in the relevant time period. Diagnoses of interest were coded and categorized in to vasculogenic, urologic, neurogenic, hormonal, drug induced and psychogenic disorders.
measure.population: Evaluable analysis population included all participants who received an index PDE5i prescription (sildenafil, tadalafil or vardenafil) during the study period (target population) and age-matched participants without any PDE5i prescription during the study period (control population). Last observation carried forward method was used.

analysis.groups_desc: Chi-square test was used to calculate p-value.

outcome.time_frame: Day 0 to Day 91 post index prescription
outcome.population: Evaluable analysis population included all participants who received an index PDE5i prescription (sildenafil, tadalafil or vardenafil) during the study period (target population) and age-matched participants without any PDE5i prescription during the study period (control population). reported_events.desc: As it was a retrospective study and no safety data (adverse events and serious adverse events) were analyzed, hence number of participants affected and at risk were reported as 0.

group.title: Index PDE5i Prescription
group.description: Participants who received index phosphodiesterase type 5 inhibitor (PDE5i) (sildenafil, tadalafil or vardenafil) prescription between January 1, 1999 and June 30, 2008, as identified from the United Kingdom - The Health Improvement Network (UK-THIN) database (target population).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
